title: End of World War II
description: The war in Europe concludes with the surrender of Germany in May, followed by the surrender of Japan in September, ending the deadliest conflict in human history.

title: Invention of the Printing Press
description: Johannes Gutenberg introduces mechanical movable type printing to Europe, sparking the Printing Revolution.

title: First Successful Airplane Flight
description: The Wright brothers, Orville and Wilbur, achieve the first sustained, controlled, and powered heavier-than-air flight.

title: Discovery of Penicillin
description: Alexander Fleming discovers the antibiotic substance penicillin from the Penicillium notatum mould.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: East Germany opened its borders on November 9, 1989, allowing citizens to freely cross into West Berlin. The Berlin Wall, a Cold War symbol, was torn down, marking the collapse of communism in Eastern Europe.

title: Tiananmen Square Massacre
description: On June 4, 1989, the Chinese government violently suppressed pro-democracy protests in Beijing, resulting in hundreds or possibly thousands of deaths.

title: Velvet Revolution in Czechoslovakia
description: A peaceful protest movement that began in November 1989 led to the fall of the communist government in Czechoslovakia, transitioning the country to democracy.

title: Collapse of Communist Regimes in Eastern Europe
description: In 1989, communist governments in Poland, Hungary, Bulgaria, and Romania fell one after another as democratic movements spread throughout the region.

title: Poland Holds Semi-Free Elections
description: In June 1989, Poland held partially free elections, leading to the victory of Solidarity and marking the beginning of the end for communist rule in the country.

title: Hungary Opens Border with Austria
description: In May 1989, Hungary dismantled its border fence with Austria, allowing East Germans to flee to the West—one of the first cracks in the Iron Curtain.

title: Execution of Nicolae Ceaușescu
description: On December 25, 1989, Romanian dictator Nicolae Ceaușescu and his wife were executed after a revolution that overthrew the communist regime.

title: Reunification Talks Begin in Germany
description: Following the fall of the Berlin Wall, East and West Germany initiated discussions that eventually led to reunification in 1990.

title: End of One-Party Rule in Bulgaria
description: In November 1989, longtime Bulgarian leader Todor Zhivkov was removed from power, signaling the end of communist rule in Bulgaria.

title: Baltic Independence Movements Rise
description: In 1989, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania intensified efforts for independence from the Soviet Union, organizing mass protests and human chains.

title: Malta Summit Ends Cold War
description: In December 1989, U.S. President George H. W. Bush and Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev met at the Malta Summit, effectively declaring the Cold War over.

title: South African Reforms Begin
description: In 1989, F.W. de Klerk became President of South Africa and began dismantling apartheid, signaling the start of a major political transformation.

title: Temporal Contamination
description: You introduced a modern smartphone to 1955, causing a severe timeline disruption. The future is now uncertain.

title: Premature Enlightenment
description: You taught early humans how to create and control fire thousands of years ahead of schedule. Their societal development has become dangerously accelerated.

title: Da Vinci's Anomaly
description: You left a solar-powered calculator in Leonardo da Vinci's workshop. His inventions are now centuries ahead of their time, causing technological chaos.
